article_text:
VIDEO: The entrepreneur is in

• Advice from one whos done it -- from starting a business to exiting the business • Family businesses are the absolute embodiment of entrepreneurism

STOCKTONNovember 24, 2013 9:00pmFrom number crunching to craft beer to a mobile wine bottling company, Jim Collins has been there, done that, and sold a number of T-shirts along the way.

Now hes offering his insight to students at the University of the Pacific in Stockton where he is the universitys first entrepreneur in residence.

CVBT talked with him about recently about starting and building a small business.

Thanks for watching! If you have a minute, please let us know your thoughts by clicking on the cartoon balloon icon below. All comments are read by CVBT editors prior to posting.

article_metadata.keywords: California, Central Valley, business, San Joaquin Valley, Great Central Valley, news, urban sprawl, rural, real estate, housing, farming, dairy, agribusiness, cotton, oil, gasoline, ethanol, biodiesel, alternative fuels, prices, Kern, Tulare, Kings, Fresno, Madera, Merced, Mariposa, Stanislaus, San Joaquin, Stockton, Modesto, Merced, Visalia, Portervile, Bakersfield, Schwarzenegger
article_metadata.description: Central Valley Business Times. Probing the Business of California's Great Central Valley.
